bib.title: ALOS-2 and Sentinel-1 use for retrieving soil moisture over cereal fields in semi-arid area: the Kairouan plain–central Tunisia
bib.citation: Remote Sensing for Agriculture, Ecosystems, and Hydrology XXIII 11856, 233-242, 2021
bib.author: Emna Ayari and Zeineb Kassouk and Zohra Lili-Chabaane and Nicolas Baghdadi and Safa Bousbih and Mehrez Zribi
bib.conference: Remote Sensing for Agriculture, Ecosystems, and Hydrology XXIII
bib.abstract: In the present study, we evaluate the potential of multi-incidence L-band and C-band data to retrieve soil moisture. In -situ measurements were acquired during satellite acquisitions over cereal fields in the Kairouan plain in central Tunisia (semi-arid area). Analysing radar data, L-band Advanced Land Observing Satellite-2 multi-incidence data (28°, 32.5° and 36°) in HH (L-HH) and HV (L-HV) polarizations and C-band like-polarization Sentinel-1data, with an incidence angle of approximately 39°, (C-VV) are strongly impacted by soil roughness. In addition, results highlight the sensitivity of L-band data to soil moisture in dense cover class where Normalized Vegetation Difference Index (NDVI) values are higher than 0.6.
